author: daxian-dbw
body:
The package prerequisite URL tests have been failing intermittently recently, because sometimes the WMF download URLs lead to a "we're sorry, this download is no longer available" page, even though the URLs actually work in the web browser. I'm disabling those tests for now.

Close #5567

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Can we try adding a simple retry before disabling?

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT Sure, I will use retries and let's see how it goes.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: The failed tests are known. #5605 will make them pending for now.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
We could run the package prerequisite URL tests with another test tag ("Doc").
Also could we run tests by demand from GitHub PR page? We could run the package prerequisite URL tests and feature tests by this way. It seems to me more comfortable - a maintainer or reviewer would run the tests without requesting the contributor and waiting.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: I'm not sure what is best for this. We need to ensure the links work, but they erroneously fail often. A retry will help sometimes, but many times when this test fails it fails for days at a time.

title: Add retry logic to prerequisite URL tests
